title: Chronology conflict detection across NEXT, SWARM-LANES, and artifacts

missing_link_events.next_event_text: S186: user-directed "swarm the swarm" evolution replay executed across F-EVO2/F-EVO3/F-EVO4 (`experiments/evolution/f-evo2-contamination-s186-swarm-the-swarm.json`, `experiments/evolution/f-evo2-retention-s186-swarm-the-swarm.json`, `experiments/evolution/f-evo3-protocol-cadence-s186-swarm-the-swarm.json`, `experiments/evolution/f-evo4-multibranch-s186-swarm-the-swarm.json`). Check mode `assumption+verification+coordination`; expectation was contamination would stay MEDIUM while queue-pressure improves and multibranch pass remains intact. Actual: contamination improved from `0.5184` to `0.4784` (MEDIUM, ready/running `1.0`), cadence couplings stayed directionally stable (mutation-overhead `+0.3033`, mutation-destabilization `+0.4554`), and multibranch verdict remained full pass (`verdict_strength=1.0`, overall score `0.6989`). Diff: expectation confirmed on contamination and multibranch stability; retention bottleneck persists (`338` rows, only one retained base lane, READY residue `107`) so next action is quality-linkage for retained mutations plus continued READY-lane conversion.

S186: unused-surface swarming pass landed via `tools/orient.py` (`coordination` check mode): orientation now emits an `Underused core tools` section from recent session-log evidence (last 20 sessions) alongside unrun domain experiments, so dormant swarm capabilities are visible at startup without a manual audit. Regression coverage added in `tools/test_orient.py` (4/4). Diff: unused-part activation is now first-class in the default orientation loop.

S186: floor-`0.3333` coordinator slot-1 operations execution completed via F-OPS3 queue-aging replays (`coordination+verification` check modes) with artifacts `experiments/operations-research/f-ops3-queue-aging-s186-fullhistory-rerun.json` and `experiments/operations-research/f-ops3-queue-aging-s186-synthetic-rerun.json` (using synthetic backlog slice file `experiments/operations-research/f-ops3-queue-aging-s186-synthetic-lanes.md`). Expectation: explicit backlog-slice injection should separate queue-aging from recency-bias so slot policy can progress beyond tie/null. Actual: live replay remains narrow (`ready_session_min=184`, `job_count=20`) and effectively tie (`score=0.9` both), while synthetic backlog replay separates policies (`job_count=26`, ready window `180..186`) but favors `recency_bias` (`0.4038` vs `-0.5077`) because naive queue-aging induces high `global_delay_rate=1.0` and `mean_positive_shift=2.0` despite stale-unresolved improvement (`0.0` vs `0.2308`). Diff: slot-1 produced actionable F-OPS3 signal (aging policy needs guardrails for global-delay/shift, not just stale reduction); coordinator can advance to slot-2 information-science.

S186: swarm-the-swarm concreteness pass landed in domain frontiers: `domains/information-science/tasks/FRONTIER.md` now includes a copy/paste F-IS4 runbook (slot fan-out, blocker reassignment, overlap-tuning command), and `domains/history/tasks/FRONTIER.md` now includes executable F-HIS2/F-HIS3 examples grounded in chronology metrics from `experiments/history/f-his2-chronology-conflicts-s186.json`.

S186: repository-structure pass added `references/` + `recordings/` as first-class folders with canonical policy in `docs/SWARM-STRUCTURE.md`, map updates in README/INDEX, and maintenance enforcement (`check_structure_layout`) with regression coverage (`tools/test_structure_layout.py`) so disallowed file types in those folders are automatically flagged.

S186: lane contract enforcement hardened in maintenance/tests for F121/F-GAM3 continuity: active-lane structural checks now require explicit `available` + `next_step` tags (alongside `setup/focus/blocked/human_open_item`) and `tools/test_swarm_lanes.py` enforces the same contract. Appended contract-refresh rows for active domain-expert lanes so quick-check returned to NOTICE-only.

S186: scheduling-quality audit via `python3 tools/change_quality.py` shows no current improvement trend: S184-S186 rated WEAK (scores 0.00) with 50/50/0% overhead and no L/P/frontier advancement; long-term trend remains DECLINING (-38%). Action: scheduling-quality elevated to top next-session priority.

S185: compactness swarm pass executed on highest-growth knowledge tier: compacted `tasks/FRONTIER.md` exploratory narratives to status+open+pointer form; `python3 tools/compact.py` moved proxy-K drift from +7.5% DUE (43,795t) to +5.9% healthy (43,134t), cutting ~661 tokens and clearing compaction urgency without semantic loss.

S184: quality periodic rerun (`python3 tools/change_quality.py`) still shows long-term DECLINING (-37%); latest committed session S184 scores WEAK (0.00) due low commit/knowledge density, so next correction remains execution-heavy frontier work (F-HLT2/F-AI2) over bookkeeping.

S184: orient stale-experiment detection hardened — `tools/orient.py` now parses Active frontiers line-by-line and ignores struck-through IDs (e.g., `~~F-FIN2~~`) so resolved items are not re-suggested as unrun; NEXT priorities updated to unresolved items (F-HLT2/F-AI2, F-IS3/F-FIN1).

S184: maintenance DUE cleared — compacted L-261 (22→16 lines) and L-266 (21→16 lines) to pass lesson-length policy while preserving rules/findings; promoted L-267 from draft and ran `python3 tools/sync_state.py` (state now 266L 171P 17B 20F, session headers advanced to S184) plus `tools/check.ps1 --quick` (NOTICE-only).

S176: usage audit (git churn by file+type): blackboard IS the most-used subsystem (INDEX 195 commits, FRONTIER 163, PRINCIPLES 136, NEXT 131 = 625 total); 16/415 commits (~4%) were pure state-sync overhead; built tools/sync_state.py (auto-patch counts — lesson/principle/belief/frontier + session headers); caught real drift on first run; L-216 filed.

S173: tools/substrate_detect.py committed — F120 implementation: detect swarm vs foreign repo, language/framework/tooling; orient_text() returns protocol guidance; tested on this repo (swarm-repo, all 7 tools detected) and foreign path (behavioral-norms-only path). Advances F120 from OPEN to first concrete implementation.

inversion_events.next_event_text: S184: F-AI2/F-HLT2 controlled sync-correlation replicated at larger N (`tools/wiki_swarm.py --coord-experiment --trials 2000 --error-rate 0.2 --seed 184`): async leader-follower error correlation stayed near zero (-0.0162) while forced sync remained perfectly correlated (1.0), and joint error rate stayed ~5.4x higher under sync (0.2025 vs 0.0375). Artifact: `experiments/ai/f-ai2-hlt2-sync-correlation-s184.json`.
